repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
**Problems**

When launching Neovim on Terminal.app on macOS (Apple Terminal,) it briefly shows like
`p$qm+q5463;524742;73657472676266;73657472676262$qm` in orange background color partially on the screen.

**Solution**

Since Apple Terminal seems not supporting synchronized output and extended underline, calling `tui_request_term_mode` and `tui_query_extended_underline` caused this unexpected output.

Therefore, if we know it's Apple Terminal (when `nsterm` is `true`,) do not call these checks.

Tested on Terminal.app (2.14, 453) on macOS 14.4.1.

comment_data.body: ~~The whole point of doing this query is so that we _don't_ have to hard code terminal support.~~

The query determines whether a terminal supports mode 2026 or not, but Apple Terminal does not even support the query itself. The comment should reflect this.

```suggestion
  // Some terminals (such as Terminal.app) do not support DECRQM, so skip the query.
```

Yes, in general we expect terminals not to barf if we request things that are unknown to them. But in some narrow cases, we may choose to "stop the bleeding" by special casing. But that should only be for egregious cases. This one looks fairly painful, and the fix appears to be cheap, so we can special case it.

Oops, it should say DECRQSS here
```suggestion
  // Terminal.app also doesn't support DECRQSS.
```
It's better to say consistenly "Terminal.app" in the comment as well, thanks!

comment_regular_data.body:
Here is actual visual issue on Terminal.app without this patch appearing when Neovim launched.
![Example](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/13096/5997a9e5-f065-4539-8b92-bd6b00e59e70)

It's strange that unit test on macOS 12.0 failed on the unrelated part of code
```
RUN       typval.c dict extend() works: 45.00 ms ERR
```
Likely... it's flaky test as like other tests skipped...? -- Yes it is.

What is the problem with `tui_request_term_mode`? The output you're seeing is only from the DECRQSS sequence, not DECRQM.

Ah ok I just tried it in Apple Terminal myself, it indeed does not support DECRQM.

> What is the problem with `tui_request_term_mode`? The output you're seeing is only from the DECRQSS sequence, not DECRQM.
> 
> Ah ok I just tried it in Apple Terminal myself, it indeed does not support DECRQM.

Yeah, the first `p` in the screen short I attached is coming from `tui_request_term_mode`.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(tui): disable sync output and extended underline check for Apple Terminal
